author: Sukrita Baruah
title: Assam repeals Muslim Marriage Act: ‘Key step in journey towards UCC’ | India News - The Indian Express
text: The Assam Cabinet has decided to repeal the Assam Muslim Marriage and Divorce Registration Act 1935, cabinet minister Jayanta Malla Baruah announced Friday night, calling it “a very important step in the journey towards a Uniform Civil Code” in the state. This comes weeks after Uttarakhand became the first state in the country to pass a Uniform Civil Code in its assembly. According to the 2011 census, Muslims make up 34% of Assam’s population, standing at 1.06 crore out of a total population of 3.12 crore. A little after midnight, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma posted on social media, “On 23.22024, the Assam cabinet made a significant decision to repeal the age-old Assam Muslim Marriages & Divorces Registration Act. This act contained provisions allowing marriage registration even if the bride and groom had not reached the legal ages of 18 and 21, as required by law. This move marks another significant step towards prohibiting child marriages in Assam.” Following a cabinet meeting on Friday evening, Baruah, while briefing the media, stated that the main objective of the decision is to move towards a Uniform Civil Code. “The Assam Muslim Marriage and Divorce Registration Act 1935 – on the basis of which 94 Muslim registrars had even now been doing the registration and divorce of Muslim marriages in the state – has been repealed. Today’s Cabinet has removed this Act as a result of which, after today, Muslim marriage registration or divorce registration cannot happen through this Act. We have a Special Marriage Act, so we want all marriages to happen under the Special Marriage Act,” he said. The now repealed Act had authorised the local government to grant a licence to any person, being a Muslim, to register Muslim marriages and divorces, “which have been effected within certain limits, on application being made for such registration”. It also lay down the scope and responsibilities of such registrars. Stating that it is a “colonial act” and “not in line with today’s society”, Baruah tied the decision to the state government’s crackdown against child marriage, as part of which over 4,000 people have been arrested. “Through this, we would also see underage marriages being registered – of boys below 21 years or girls below 18 years. So this is a big step towards us being able to completely eradicate child marriage,” he said. He added that the respective District Commissioners will take custody of the 94 registrars operating under this Act, and that the Cabinet has decided to provide them with a one-time financial compensation of Rs 2 lakh. Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has repeatedly said that the Assam government is working towards introducing a UCC, and that it would be the third state after Uttarakhand and Gujarat to do so. At the same time, it has also been working on a bill to ban polygamy, making it a criminal offence. The state government was in the final leg of its anti-polygamy bill and was due to introduce it in the ongoing assembly session. However, last week, Sarma suggested that it was likely to be put on hold for the time being with the state cabinet looking to “align” it with a UCC. Sarma has also previously stated that the state’s tribal communities will be exempt from a UCC.

title: New species of marine slug found in Odisha named after President Droupadi Murmu
text:
Bhubaneshwar: A new variety of marine slug molluscs that live primarily in marine habitats and were recently discovered on wet and sandy beaches of Odisha and Bengal by the Zoological Survey of India (ZSI) has been named after President Droupadi Murmu, officials said.
Melanochlamys Droupadi, the slug species named after Murmu, is a head-shield brownish-black sea slug with a ruby red spot and a maximum length of up to seven mm, they said.
The marine slug was found along the three-km stretch from the low inter-tidal zones of the Digha in West Bengal and Udaypur in Odisha coast over the last two years by the scientists led by Prasad Chandra Tudu of ZSI, officials added. The species was confirmed after a thorough examination of morphological, anatomical and molecular characteristics.
"We collected 145 specimens from the north-eastern coast of the Bay of Bengal. This is the second species of headshield sea slug from India as most of its congeners are found in temperate regions of the Indo-Pacific Oceanic realm. Their reproduction apparently occurs between November and January," said Tudu, the lead author of the study, which was published in the peer-reviewed journal Molluscan Research earlier this week.
"As scientists, we have the freedom to name species which we discover. Since both the president and I come from the Rairangpur area of Mayurbhanj, I decided to name the species after her to honour her ascension to the high office," Tudu said.
Sea slugs are a group of molluscs that live primarily in marine habitats and are slug-like. They can be found from the shallow intertidal to the deep sea and from the polar regions to the tropics. The sea slugs are rapid hunters and feed upon mobile prey such as other shelled and unshelled sea slugs, roundworms, marine worms and small fishes. So far, 18 species have been discovered across the globe, including one tropical species from the Gulf of Thailand, ZSI officials said.
This particular species of sea slug is hermaphrodite (having both male and female reproductive parts), however, they need another sea slug for reproduction, the zoologists say.
Incidentally, the ZSI scientists had named another variety of head-shield sea slugs - melanochlamys bengalensis - discovered along the coast from Digha and Dhamra in 2022, after the Bay of Bengal.
In 2018, scientists at NASA named a bacteria that formed on the filters of the International Space Station after former president and missile man APJ Abdul Kalam. In 2017, scientists from the Botanical Survey of India in Bengal named a new plant species after Kalam.
In 2000, a cactus in the Cactii Garden of Bhubaneswar's Regional Plant Resource Centre was named after the then Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee. In 2018, zoologists from the Estuarine Biology Regional Centre named a species of eel Gymnothorax Odishi, after it was discovered at Odisha's Gopalpur beach.

title: La demarcaci\u00f3n de Tarragona recogi\u00f3 este jueves registros de lluvia de cerca de 80 litros por metro cuadrado
text: DANA La demarcación de Tarragona recogió este jueves registros de lluvia de cerca de 80 litros por metro cuadrado La DANA se mantendrá con intensidad en el Ebre y el Camp de Tarragona en los próximos días El sur de Cataluña ha recogido registros de lluvia de cerca de 80 litros por metro cuadrado este jueves, consecuencia de la DANA que asola esta zona y la Comunidad Valenciana desde el martes. En concreto, en l'Aldea (Baix Ebre) se han acumulado 78,2 litros de precipitación, mientras que en los Alfacs (Montsià) el registro ha sido de 70,4 litros. En el Perelló (Baix Ebre) han caído 65,6 y en el Parc Natural dels Ports han sido 63,9. En Amposta el registro ha sido de 58,8, en Aldover (Baix Ebre) de 58 y en Horta de Sant Joan (Terra Alta) 57. Los Bomberos han recibido, desde el inicio del episodio, 192 avisos por servicios relacionados con el temporal por todo el país, y durante las últimas horas los avisos se han concentrado en las Terres de l'Ebre. Desde las once de la mañana de este jueves los Bomberos han atendido 49 servicios en la Región de Emergencias de Terres de l'Ebre. Los servicios han sido principalmente para atender inundaciones en bajos y calles y problemas diversos en las canalizaciones y desagües. Entre los más destacados se ha atendido un servicio en una escuela de Tortosa, en la que se ha agujereado una parte de la cubierta por el peso del agua sin causar ningún daño personal. En Bot ha cedido un muro de contención de unos 6 metros de altura en la calle de la Verge de Fontcalda. En este caso, tampoco ha habido heridos. Y el último servicio destacado es en l'Ampolla, donde un vehículo con un ocupante había quedado rodeado de agua en el barranco de Sant Pere. Los Bomberos han activado cinco dotaciones y la persona ha podido salir sin consecuencias. Desde que las tormentas han empezado a ser especialmente intensas en las Terres de l'Ebre, los Bomberos han reforzado el dispositivo habitual en la Región para dar respuesta en caso de que sea necesario y los efectivos han estado haciendo rutas preventivas por las zonas afectadas por el temporal, para valorar la afectación. Por otro lado, desde que empezó el episodio y hasta las nueve de la noche de este jueves, el teléfono de emergencias 112 ha recibido 707 llamadas que han generado 583 incidentes. Por comarcas, donde se han recibido más ha sido en el Barcelonès (159), seguido del Vallès Occidental (100), el Baix Ebre (70), el Tarragonès (47), el Baix Llobregat (38) y el Montsià (35). Además, según informa el Servicio Catalán de Tráfico, durante la tarde de este jueves siete vías han sido cortadas por inundaciones, casi todas en las Terres de l'Ebre. Con el paso de las horas la situación ha ido mejorando y las vías se han ido reabriendo. Por la noche quedaban dos vías cortadas, la T-301 y la TV-3341.
